page.title: 02Historical Mural Mosaic
page.content: A major event in 1985 is the building of the new by-pass(seeTransport).Where it crosses the Ebbw at Crosskeys an underpass follows the river bank and the walls of this under-pass bear a mosaic mural depicting Crosskeys'life in the 1920's and 1985.(Photo"B").The mural shows a famous street corner,a marching band, a Whitsun tea-party, a rugby match and a Baptist "Band of Hope".The foreground shows an Italian ice-cream seller,typical of the valleys.Opposite is a scene from the mining world with a retired miner, Mr. Clarke,portrayed in 1985 mining gear. The mural,commissioned by Gwent County Council was made by Mr.Kenneth Budd and his son Oliver of Kent.They have designed other murals in S.Wales(in Newport & Caerleon)as well as on Birmingham's inner ring road.
